page.title: 06CARNEIGIE ARTS CENTRE
page.content: This is situated on Finkle St.The manager is Paul Sherwen. The Carneigie was founded in 1904 by Workington Borough Council and the cost of Â£7500 funded by the american Carneigie Foundation.The building, the former town library, is divided into an Arts centre and Unemployed centre. The Arts centre has a theatre which has professional live plays and music of all types. Exhibitions of paintings and photography, professional and amateur, plus local musical shows, dancing,pantomimes, etc. 700 people per week from all walks of life and all ages visit the Unemployed centre. The workshops give training in woodwork, metalwork,a wide variety of artistc recreations, keep-fit, dancing and the Youth-Project.A counselling service is available.Director is Jack Dummigan, with 15 staff.
